title: Securing Circuits against Constant-Rate Tampering.
abstract: We present a compiler that converts any circuit into one that remains secure even if a constant fraction of its wires are tampered with. Following the seminal work of Ishaii¾?et.i¾?al.i¾?Eurocrypt 2006, we consider adversaries who may choose an arbitrary set of wires to corrupt, and may set each such wire toi¾?0 or toi¾?1, or may toggle with the wire. We prove that such adversaries, who continuously tamper with the circuit, can learn at most logarithmically many bits of secret information in addition to black-box access to the circuit. Our results are information theoretic.
